I wrote an article about my usual workflow: Deploying Python Web Applications.

In my previous work we had real genius guy on deployment duties, he deployed application (Python, SQL, Perl and Java code) as set of deb files built for Ubuntu.
Unfortunately now, I have no such support.
We are deploying apps manually to virtualenv-ed environments with separate nginx configs for FastCGI.
We use paver to deploy to remote servers.
This looks like a good place to start: http://www.unessa.net/en/hoyci/2007/06/using-capistrano-deploy-django-apps/
